sen.j: 高橋 順太郎（たかはし じゅんたろう、安政3年3月28日 (旧暦)（1856年5月2日） - 大正9年（1920年）6月4日）は石川県金沢市出身、医学博士。
sen.e: Juntaro TAKAHASHI (May 2, 1856 - June 4, 1920) came from Kanazawa City, Ishikawa Prefecture and was a Doctor of Medicine.
Juntaro TAKAHASHI (May 2, 1856 - June 4, 1920) came from Kanazawa City, Ishikawa Prefecture and was a Doctor of Medicine.
Juntaro TAKAHASHI (May 2, 1856 - June 4, 1920) came from Kanazawa City, Ishikawa Prefecture and was a Doctor of Medicine.

sen.j: 東京帝国大学医科大学、初代薬理学教授。
sen.e: He was the first professor of pharmacology at Tokyo Imperial University Medical School.
He was the first professor of pharmacology at Tokyo Imperial University Medical School.
He was the first professor of pharmacology at Tokyo Imperial University Medical School.

sen.j: 従三位勲二等。
sen.e: Juntaro was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Kunnito (Order of Second Class).
Juntaro was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Kunnito (Order of Second Class).
Juntaro was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Kunnito (Order of Second Class).

sen.j: 通称：順太郎、諱：信之（もりゆき）。
sen.e: Common name: Juntaro, Real name: Moriyuki
Common name: Juntaro, Real name: Moriyuki
Common name: Juntaro, Real name: Moriyuki

sen.j: 安政3年3月28日（1856年5月2日）、加賀藩知行御算用者小頭高橋荘兵衛（110石・通称：荘兵衛、諱：作善）・石橋鈴（御算用者石橋良蔵・長女）の嫡男として、金澤勘解由町（金沢市瓢箪町）に生まれる。
sen.e: On May 2, 1856 Juntaro was born the legitimate son of Sobei TAKAHASHI (110 koku of salary, commonly called Sobei but with the real name Sakuzen) who was a kogashira (group leader) of enfeoffment finance officers for the Kaga Domain, and Suzu ISHIBASHI (first daughter of Ryozo ISHIBASHI, finance officer) in Kageyu Town, Kanazawa (Hyotan Town, Kanazawa City).

On May 2, 1856 Juntaro was born the legitimate son of Sobei TAKAHASHI (110 koku of salary, commonly called Sobei but with the real name Sakuzen) who was a kogashira (group leader) of enfeoffment finance officers for the Kaga Domain, and Suzu ISHIBASHI (first daughter of Ryozo ISHIBASHI, finance officer) in Kageyu Town, Kanazawa (Hyotan Town, Kanazawa City).

On May 2, 1856 Juntaro was born the legitimate son of Sobei TAKAHASHI (110 koku of salary, commonly called Sobei but with the real name Sakuzen) who was a kogashira (group leader) of enfeoffment finance officers for the Kaga Domain, and Suzu ISHIBASHI (first daughter of Ryozo ISHIBASHI, finance officer) in Kageyu Town, Kanazawa (Hyotan Town, Kanazawa City).

sen.j: 兄弟は直次郎、花山という弟2人と、他所、敬、留という3人の妹がいる。
sen.e: Juntaro had two younger brothers, Naojiro and Kazan, and three younger sisters: Yoso, Kei and Tome.
sen.cmt: 他所： 読み方不明 敬： 読み方不明
sen.e: Juntaro had two younger brothers, Naojiro and Kazan, and three younger sisters: Yoso, Kei, and Tome.
Juntaro had two younger brothers, Naojiro and Kazan, and three younger sisters: Yoso, Kei, and Tome.

sen.j: 順太郎は幼年期より数学の秀れた才能を有し、特に珠算の名手であった。
sen.e: From his childhood Juntaro had a great talent for mathematics and he was especially expert at the abacus.
From his childhood Juntaro had a great talent for mathematics and he was especially skilled with the abacus.
From his childhood Juntaro had a great talent for mathematics and he was especially skilled with the abacus.

sen.j: 慶応元年（1865年）11月8日、加賀藩御算用場に雇われた。
sen.e: On December 25, 1865 Juntaro was hired by the Kaga Domain osanyoba (accounting department).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On December 25, 1865 Juntaro was hired by the Kaga Domain osanyoba (accounting department).
On December 25, 1865 Juntaro was hired by the Kaga Domain osanyoba (accounting department).

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）7月6日に御算用者となる（切米四十表）。
sen.e: On August 5, 1867 he became an accounting officer, called osanyomono (salary of 40 hyo [approximately 2880 liters] of rice).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処切米四十表：「表」は「俵」と考えて訳しました。
sen.e: On August 5, 1867 he became an accounting officer, called osanyomono (salary of 40 hyo [approximately 2880 liters] of rice).
On August 5, 1867 he became an accounting officer, called osanyomono (salary of 40 hyo [approximately 2880 liters] of rice).

sen.j: 慶応元年（1865年）、11歳で藩派遣による特待生に選ばれて長崎へ留学。
sen.e: In 1865 at the age of 11 Juntaro was selected as an honor student and was dispatched to Nagasaki by the domain to study.
In 1865 at the age of eleven Juntaro was selected as an honor student and was dispatched to Nagasaki by the domain to study.
In 1865 at the age of eleven Juntaro was selected as an honor student and was dispatched to Nagasaki by the domain to study.

sen.j: この時10歳も満たない弟：直次郎も同伴している。
sen.e: At the time Juntaro was accompanied by his younger brother, Naojiro, who was not even ten years old.
At the time Juntaro was accompanied by his younger brother, Naojiro, who was not even ten years old.
At the time Juntaro was accompanied by his younger brother, Naojiro, who was not even ten years old.

sen.j: 長崎留学中、英語及び一般数学を学び、明治の初年に金沢に帰った。
sen.e: Juntaro learned English and general mathematics while studying in Nagasaki and he returned to Kanazawa in the first year of the Meiji era.
Juntaro learned English and general mathematics while studying in Nagasaki and he returned to Kanazawa in the first year of the Meiji era.
Juntaro learned English and general mathematics while studying in Nagasaki and he returned to Kanazawa in the first year of the Meiji era.

sen.j: 幕末の動乱期に父：荘兵衛・順太郎・弟の直次郎は職務・留学の為、長崎に在留していた。
sen.e: In the upheaval of the final days of Tokugawa shogunate, Juntaro's father Sobei, Juntaro and his younger brother Naojiro, lived in Nagasaki to work or study.
In the upheaval of the final days of the Tokugawa shogunate, Juntaro's father Sobei, Juntaro and his younger brother Naojiro, lived in Nagasaki to work or study.
In the upheaval of the final days of the Tokugawa shogunate, Juntaro's father Sobei, Juntaro and his younger brother Naojiro, lived in Nagasaki to work or study.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）2月7日漢学修行の為、加賀藩明倫堂の豊島安三郎に入塾。
sen.e: On February 7, 1869 Juntaro entered Meirindo school in Kaga Domain in order to study sinology under Yasusaburo TOYOSHIMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On February 7, 1869 Juntaro entered Meirindo school in Kaga Domain in order to study sinology under Yasusaburo TOYOSHIMA.
On February 7, 1869 Juntaro entered Meirindo school in Kaga Domain in order to study sinology under Yasusaburo TOYOSHIMA.

sen.j: 同年3月28日職制改正により二等中士を仰せ渡され、版籍奉還の変革により10月士族を命ぜられる。
sen.e: On March 28 of the same year, following a reorganization of the office Juntaro was appointed nito chushi (officer of the second class) and in October he was appointed shizoku (social class with the origin of samurai) due to the reform of Hansekihokan (the return of lands and people to the emperor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On March 28 of the same year, following the reorganization of the office, Juntaro was appointed nito chushi (officer of the second class) and in October was appointed shizoku (social class with the origin of samurai) due to the reform of Hansekihokan (the return of lands and people to the emperor).

On March 28 of the same year, following the reorganization of the office, Juntaro was appointed nito chushi (officer of the second class) and in October was appointed shizoku (social class with the origin of samurai) due to the reform of Hansekihokan (the return of lands and people to the emperor).

sen.j: 弟の石田直次郎は長崎留学中機械機器を学び、金沢帰国後に製作した時計。
sen.e: Juntaro's younger brother, Naojiro ISHIDA, studied machinery and equipment and produced a clock after returning to Kanazawa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Juntaro's younger brother, Naojiro ISHIDA, studied machinery and equipment and produced a clock after returning to Kanazawa.
Juntaro's younger brother, Naojiro ISHIDA, studied machinery and equipment and produced a clock after returning to Kanazawa.

sen.j: 金沢府第一号の刻印を明治5年に受けている。
sen.e: In 1872 this clock had the inscription showing it was the first clock produced in Kanazawa Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1872 this clock had an inscription showing it was the first clock produced in Kanazawa Prefecture.
In 1872 this clock had an inscription showing it was the first clock produced in Kanazawa Prefecture.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）3月加賀藩の貢進生として大学南校に入学し独逸語を専攻。
sen.e: In March 1871 Juntaro enrolled at Daigakunan-ko School as the koshin-sei student, on the recommendation of Kaga Domain, and majored in German.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In March 1871 Juntaro enrolled at Daigakunan-ko School as the koshin-sei student, on the recommendation of the Kaga Domain, and majored in German.
In March 1871 Juntaro enrolled at Daigakunan-ko School as the koshin-sei student, on the recommendation of the Kaga Domain, and majored in German.

sen.j: 明治7年（1874年）東京開成学校において鉱山学科を専攻、翌年明治8年（1875年）東京開成学校の全学科廃止により7月から大学東校（東京医学校）に転じ本科生となる。
sen.e: In 1874 he studied at the department of mining in Tokyo Kaisei School and in July of the following year, 1875, he transferred to Daigakuto-ko School (Tokyo Medical School) due to the abolition of every department in Tokyo Kaisei School, and become a regular course student.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1874 he studied at the department of mining in Tokyo Kaisei School and in July of the following year, 1875, he transferred to Daigakuto-ko School (Tokyo Medical School) due to the abolition of every department in Tokyo Kaisei School, and become a regular course student.

In 1874 he studied at the department of mining in Tokyo Kaisei School and in July of the following year, 1875, he transferred to Daigakuto-ko School (Tokyo Medical School) due to the abolition of every department in Tokyo Kaisei School, and become a regular course student.

sen.j: 明治14年（1881年）7月医学部を卒業、医学士の学位を得た。
sen.e: In July 1881 he graduated from the faculty of medicine with a bachelor of medicine degree.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In July 1881 he graduated from the faculty of medicine with a bachelor of medicine degree.
In July 1881 he graduated from the faculty of medicine with a bachelor of medicine degree.

sen.j: 同年7月14日東京大学准判任官御用掛を任免、外科当直医（大学助手）に命ぜられる。
sen.e: On the appointment and dismissal of vice junior officials in Tokyo University held on July 14 of the same year, Juntaro was appointed doctor on duty (university assistant) in the surgical department.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the appointment and dismissal of vice junior officials in Tokyo University held on July 14 of the same year, Juntaro was appointed doctor on duty (university assistant) in the surgical department.
On the appointment and dismissal of vice junior officials in Tokyo University held on July 14 of the same year, Juntaro was appointed doctor on duty (university assistant) in the surgical department.

sen.j: 医院当直医就任後、薬物学に関する研究を始め、第5回文部省国費留学生に選ばれた。
sen.e: After his appointment as doctor on duty, Juntaro started research on pharmacognosy and was selected in the fifth batch of students sponsored by the Ministry of Education to study overseas.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After his appointment as doctor on duty, Juntaro started research on pharmacognosy and was selected in the fifth batch of students sponsored by the Ministry of Education to study overseas.
After his appointment as doctor on duty, Juntaro started research on pharmacognosy and was selected in the fifth batch of students sponsored by the Ministry of Education to study overseas.

sen.j: 独逸国薬物学及び裁判化学に属する部分の研究の為、明治15年（1882年）2月4日横浜港を出発、3月23日に独逸国Berlin府に到着、同年4月ベルリン大学に留学し、同大学プスレリーブライト教授に学ぶ。
sen.e: On February 4, 1882 Juntaro travelled from Yokohama Port to study German pharmacognosy and forensic science, and on March 23 arrived in Berlin, Germany, and in April of the same year he started studying under Pslelybright in Berlin University.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処プスレリーブライト：スペル不明
sen.e: On February 4, 1882 Juntaro travelled from Yokohama Port to study German pharmacognosy and forensic science, and on March 23 arrived in Berlin, Germany, and in April of the same year he started studying under Pslelybright in Berlin University.

On February 4, 1882 Juntaro travelled from Yokohama Port to study German pharmacognosy and forensic science, and on March 23 arrived in Berlin, Germany, and in April of the same year he started studying under Pslelybright in Berlin University.

sen.j: ベルリン大学から転学し、明治17年（1884年）4月、シュトラースブルク大学の実験薬理学の開祖のオスヴァルト・シュミーデベルク教授に従事し、薬物学及び裁判化学の研鑽に励む。
sen.e: In April 1884 Juntaro transferred from Berlin University to the University of Strasbourg and he studied pharmacognosy and forensic science very diligently under Oswald Schmiedeberg, who was the pioneer of experimental pharmacology,

In April 1884 Juntaro transferred from Berlin University to the University of Strasbourg and he studied pharmacognosy and forensic science very diligently under Oswald Schmiedeberg, who was the pioneer of experimental pharmacology,

In April 1884 Juntaro transferred from Berlin University to the University of Strasbourg and he studied pharmacognosy and forensic science very diligently under Oswald Schmiedeberg, who was the pioneer of experimental pharmacology,

sen.j: 世界20ヶ国から120名の留学生が実験薬理学の開祖シュミーデベルクの下に来た。
sen.e: 120 students from 20 different countries came to study under Schmiedeberg, who was the originator of experimental pharmacology.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: 120 students from twenty different countries came to study under Schmiedeberg, who was the originator of experimental pharmacology.
120 students from twenty different countries came to study under Schmiedeberg, who was the originator of experimental pharmacology.

sen.j: その指導を受け、あるいは共同研究に加わった。
sen.e: They were coached by him or joined collaborative projects there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were coached by him or joined collaborative projects there.
They were coached by him or joined collaborative projects there.

sen.j: それぞれ帰国の後はいずれも母国に実験薬理学を移植し、その先駆者、指導者となった。
sen.e: After they returned home they all transplanted experimental pharmacology in their own countries and became pioneers and leaders in that field.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After they returned home they all transplanted experimental pharmacology into their own countries and became pioneers and leaders in that field.
After they returned home they all transplanted experimental pharmacology into their own countries and became pioneers and leaders in that field.

sen.j: こうして世界的な規模で実験薬理学研究が行われるようになって、急速な進歩をもたらした。
sen.e: In this way the study of experimental pharmacology began to be conducted world wide, which brought rapid progress in the field
In this way the study of experimental pharmacology began to be conducted world wide, which brought rapid progress in the field
In this way the study of experimental pharmacology began to be conducted world wide, which brought rapid progress in the field

sen.j: 我が国からも高橋順太郎、森島庫太、林春雄、がその留学生となって、実験薬理学の基礎を拓いていく。
sen.e: Amongst these students were Juntaro TAKAHASHI, Kurata MORISHIMA and Haruo HAYASHI from Japan, and they broke new ground with their experimental pharmacology.
Amongst these students were Juntaro TAKAHASHI, Kurata MORISHIMA and Haruo HAYASHI from Japan, and they broke new ground with their experimental pharmacology.
Amongst these students were Juntaro TAKAHASHI, Kurata MORISHIMA and Haruo HAYASHI from Japan, and they broke new ground with their experimental pharmacology.

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）、順太郎はシュトラースブルク大学留学中、シュトラースブルクの独逸人、Luise Heinrich（ルイーゼ・ハインリッヒ）と結婚。
sen.e: In 1884 while studying at the University of Strasbourg, Juntaro married a German, Luise Heinrich, from Strasbourg.
In 1884 while studying at the University of Strasbourg, Juntaro married a German, Luise Heinrich, from Strasbourg.
In 1884 while studying at the University of Strasbourg, Juntaro married a German, Luise Heinrich, from Strasbourg.

sen.j: 3年間の留学を半年間延長した後、明治18年（1885年）9月10日、アルザス・シュトラースブルクから帰国の途に着く。
sen.e: After extending his three-year study by half a year, Juntaro left Strasbourg, Alsace for Japan on September 10, 1885.
After extending his three-year study by half a year, Juntaro left Strasbourg, Alsace for Japan on September 10, 1885.
After extending his three-year study by half a year, Juntaro left Strasbourg, Alsace for Japan on September 10, 1885.

sen.j: 明治18年（1885年）10月26日横浜港到着。
sen.e: On October 26, 1885 they arrived in Yokohama Port.
On October 26, 1885 they arrived in Yokohama Port.
On October 26, 1885 they arrived in Yokohama Port.

sen.j: 明治19年（1886年）東京大学奏任官御用掛の任免を受け東京帝国大学医科大学専任講師に就任。
sen.e: In 1886 after a personnel decision by Tokyo University regarding soninkan goyogakari (higher rank officers selected on the recommendation of the Prime Minister), Juntaro assumed the post of full-time lecturer at Tokyo Imperial University Medical School,

In 1886 after a personnel decision by Tokyo University regarding soninkan goyogakari (higher rank officers selected on the recommendation of the Prime Minister), Juntaro assumed the post of full-time lecturer at Tokyo Imperial University Medical School,

In 1886 after a personnel decision by Tokyo University regarding soninkan goyogakari (higher rank officers selected on the recommendation of the Prime Minister), Juntaro assumed the post of full-time lecturer at Tokyo Imperial University Medical School,

sen.j: 薬理学講座を担当し、同年2月、初代東京帝国大学医科大学薬理学の教授となる。
sen.e: He held the chair of pharmacology and in February of the same year became the first professor of pharmacology at Tokyo Imperial University Medical School,
He held the chair of pharmacology and in February of the same year became the first professor of pharmacology at Tokyo Imperial University Medical School,
He held the chair of pharmacology and in February of the same year became the first professor of pharmacology at Tokyo Imperial University Medical School,

sen.j: 、明治24年（1891年）8月医学博士の学位を授与され
sen.e: In August 1891, Juntaro was awarded the degree of a Doctor of Medicine.
In August 1891, Juntaro was awarded the degree of Doctor of Medicine.
In August 1891, Juntaro was awarded the degree of Doctor of Medicine.

sen.j: 、同年内務省 (日本)の委託により日本薬局方調査委員に任命、。
sen.e: In the same year at the request of the Ministry of Home Affairs he was appointed a member of the investigation committee of Japanese Pharmacopoeia,
In the same year at the request of the Ministry of Home Affairs he was appointed a member of the investigation committee of Japanese Pharmacopoeia,
In the same year at the request of the Ministry of Home Affairs he was appointed a member of the investigation committee of Japanese Pharmacopoeia,

sen.j: 翌25年（1892年）10月医術開業試験医員に任命、薬学試験委員・理学文書目録編纂医員などを務めた。
sen.e: In October of the following year (1892) Juntaro was appointed a member of the committee for the examination for practicing medicine, and was sitting on the pharmaceutical examination committee and on the committee for compiling a list of scientific documents.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In October of the following year (1892) Juntaro was appointed a member of the committee for the examination for practicing medicine, and was sitting on the pharmaceutical examination committee and on the committee for compiling a list of scientific documents.

In October of the following year (1892) Juntaro was appointed a member of the committee for the examination for practicing medicine, and was sitting on the pharmaceutical examination committee and on the committee for compiling a list of scientific documents.

sen.j: 明治33年（1900年）帝国大学評議員に任命される。
sen.e: In 1990, he was appointed councilor of the Imperial University.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1990, he was appointed councilor of the Imperial University.
In 1990, he was appointed councilor of the Imperial University.

sen.j: 研究
sen.e: Research
Research
Research

sen.j: 明治初頭、日本の科学研究は治療効果と無関係に行われていた。
sen.e: At the beginning of the Meiji era the study of science in Japan was being conducted without considering the effect of treatments.
At the beginning of the Meiji era the study of science in Japan was being conducted without considering the effect of treatments.
At the beginning of the Meiji era the study of science in Japan was being conducted without considering the effect of treatments.

sen.j: 当時、動植物の成分は単に化学的結晶を抽出分離することに止まり、実際の患者に応用するに努力まで至らず。
sen.e: At that time the constituent parts of plants and animals were simply extracted and separated as chemical crystals with no effort being made to try them on actual patients.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At that time the constituent parts of plants and animals were simply extracted and separated as chemical crystals with no effort being made to try them on actual patients.
At that time the constituent parts of plants and animals were simply extracted and separated as chemical crystals with no effort being made to try them on actual patients.

sen.j: 若し偶然有効成分が単離されたとしても、化学的な実証を伴わない偶然の物であった。
sen.e: Even if an active constituent was isolated by chance, it was just a product of chance, rather than resulting from chemical demonstration.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even if an active constituent was isolated by chance, it was just a product of chance, rather than resulting from a chemical demonstration.
Even if an active constituent was isolated by chance, it was just a product of chance, rather than resulting from a chemical demonstration.

sen.j: 生体の中にある科学働体が摂取されておこる変化を攻究する学問(実験薬理学）を日本に導入したのは高橋であった。
sen.e: TAKAHASHI introduced experimental pharmacology to Japan: the study of changes on a living organism induced by the ingestion of a chemical agent.
TAKAHASHI introduced experimental pharmacology to Japan: the study of changes on a living organism induced by the ingestion of a chemical agent.
TAKAHASHI introduced experimental pharmacology to Japan: the study of changes on a living organism induced by the ingestion of a chemical agent.

sen.j: 彼の研究テーマは動植物成分の科学薬理的研究である。
sen.e: His research subject was the scientific pharmacological study of the constituents of plants and animals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His research subject was the scientific pharmacological study of the constituents of plants and animals.
His research subject was the scientific pharmacological study of the constituents of plants and animals.

sen.j: 日本の長い伝統に育まれて来た加賀藩の秘薬（漢方薬）に目を向け、漢薬の成分の科学研究を行う。
sen.e: He turned his attention to secret medicine (herbal medicine) in Kaga Domain, which had been nurtured in a long Japanese tradition, and studied the components of herbal medicine in a scientific manner.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He turned his attention to secret medicine (herbal medicine) in the Kaga Domain, that had been nurtured in as a long Japanese tradition, and studied the components of herbal medicine in a scientific manner.

He turned his attention to secret medicine (herbal medicine) in the Kaga Domain, that had been nurtured in as a long Japanese tradition, and studied the components of herbal medicine in a scientific manner.

sen.j: 瓜蒂（かてい）、ハシリドコロ（ろうと）、コガネバナ（おうごん）、麻黄（まおう）、商陸（しょうりく）、河豚、肝油の成分研究を行った。
sen.e: Juntaro studied the constituents of oriental melon, European scopolia, Baikal skullcap, ephedra, phytolacca esculenta, puffer fish and fish-liver oil.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Juntaro studied the constituents of the oriental melon, European scopolia, Baikal skullcap, ephedra, phytolacca esculenta, puffer fish, and fish-liver oil.
Juntaro studied the constituents of the oriental melon, European scopolia, Baikal skullcap, ephedra, phytolacca esculenta, puffer fish, and fish-liver oil.

sen.j: 莨菪根からスコポレチン、黄芩からスグデラリン、商陸からフィトラッコトキシンを単離、成分分析を行う。
sen.e: He isolated scopoletin from scopoliae rhizoma, scutellarin from Baikal skullcap and phytolaccotoxin from phytolacca esculenta and analyzed their constituents.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処スグデラリン,フィトラッコトキシン： スペル不明
sen.e: He isolated scopoletin from scopoliae rhizoma, scutellarin from Baikal skullcap and phytolaccotoxin from phytolacca esculenta and analyzed their constituents.
He isolated scopoletin from scopoliae rhizoma, scutellarin from Baikal skullcap and phytolaccotoxin from phytolacca esculenta and analyzed their constituents.

sen.j: 当時外国から輸入されていた貴重薬物塩酸レミジン（キニーネ誘導体の肺炎治療薬）ジキタリス製剤及びエフェドリンについて薬理学的研究を行う。
sen.e: Juntaro did pharmacological research on the important medicine remijin hydrochloride (a pneumonia drug derived from quinine), which at the time was imported from abroad, and on digitalis preparation and ephedrine.

Juntaro did pharmacological research on the important medicine remijin hydrochloride (a pneumonia drug derived from quinine), which at the time was imported from abroad, and on digitalis preparation and ephedrine.

Juntaro did pharmacological research on the important medicine remijin hydrochloride (a pneumonia drug derived from quinine), which at the time was imported from abroad, and on digitalis preparation and ephedrine.

sen.j: これら研究による成分単離の化学的研究分析並びに薬理研究を行い。
sen.e: Juntaro made chemical and pharmacological analysis and studied their isolated constituents.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Juntaro made chemical and pharmacological analysis and studied their isolated constituents.
Juntaro made chemical and pharmacological analysis and studied their isolated constituents.

sen.j: 実際患者に利用することを考え研究を進め、日本における治療的応用の基礎を築いた。
sen.e: He proceeded with these studies with the intention of applying them to actual patients and so laid the groundwork for their therapeutic application in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He proceeded with these studies with the intention of applying them to actual patients laying the groundwork for their therapeutic application in Japan.
He proceeded with these studies with the intention of applying them to actual patients laying the groundwork for their therapeutic application in Japan.

sen.j: 河豚之毒 （高橋順太郎・猪子吉人「河豚之毒」明治22年（1889年）『帝国大学紀要医科』第1冊第5号）
sen.e: Poison of Puffer Fish (Juntaro TAKAHASHI and Yoshito INOKO, 1889, "Journal of Medical Department, Imperial University " Vol.1 no.5)
Poison of Puffer Fish (Juntaro TAKAHASHI and Yoshito INOKO, 1889, "Journal of Medical Department, Imperial University " Vol.1 no.5)
Poison of Puffer Fish (Juntaro TAKAHASHI and Yoshito INOKO, 1889, "Journal of Medical Department, Imperial University " Vol.1 no.5)

sen.j: 業績
sen.e: Achievements
Achievements
Achievements

sen.j: 高橋の業績で特に著名なのがフグ毒である。
sen.e: One of TAKAHASHI's most famous achievements is his study on puffer fish poison.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: One of TAKAHASHI's most famous achievements is his study on puffer fish poison.
One of TAKAHASHI's most famous achievements is his study on puffer fish poison.

sen.j: 日本の魚類の中で毒を持つものとして有名な河豚について化学的、薬理学的研究を推し進めた。
sen.e: He undertook chemical and pharmacological research on puffer fish, which is famous in Japan for its poison
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He undertook chemical and pharmacological research on puffer fish, which is famous in Japan for its poison
He undertook chemical and pharmacological research on puffer fish, which is famous in Japan for its poison

sen.j: 明治20年（1887年）から助教授の猪子吉人と共にフグ毒の研究を始めた。
sen.e: In 1887 Juntaro started researching puffer fish poison together with assistant professor Yoshito INOKO,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1887 Juntaro started researching puffer fish poison together with assistant professor Yoshito INOKO,
In 1887 Juntaro started researching puffer fish poison together with assistant professor Yoshito INOKO,

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）フグ毒が生魚の体内にあること、水に解けやすいことなどから、高橋はそれがタンパク質（酵素）様のものでないことを証明し、毒力表を作成した。
sen.e: In 1889 TAKAHASHI proved that because puffer fish poison was inside of the fish body and was easy to dissolve in water it couldn't be proteinic (enzyme-like), and he produced a chart of toxicity strength.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1889 TAKAHASHI proved that because puffer fish poison was inside of the fish body and was easy to dissolve in water it couldn't be proteinic (enzyme-like), and he produced a chart of toxicity strength.

In 1889 TAKAHASHI proved that because puffer fish poison was inside of the fish body and was easy to dissolve in water it couldn't be proteinic (enzyme-like), and he produced a chart of toxicity strength.

sen.j: これは動物試験を基にした実験薬理学の端緒となった。
sen.e: This was the beginning of experimental pharmacology based on animal experimentation.
This was the beginning of experimental pharmacology based on animal experimentation.
This was the beginning of experimental pharmacology based on animal experimentation.

sen.j: 彼は動植物成分の効果を薬理学的に研究分析して真に有効な物質を得んと努力した。
sen.e: He studied and analyzed the effect of the constituents of plants and animals pharmacologically, and made an effort to obtain truly effective substances.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He studied and analyzed the effect of the constituents of plants and animals pharmacologically, and made an effort to obtain truly effective substances.
He studied and analyzed the effect of the constituents of plants and animals pharmacologically, and made an effort to obtain truly effective substances.

sen.j: 有効成分の化学研究に新しい方向性を示した実験薬理学の医学者であった。
sen.e: As a medical scientist in experimental pharmacology he gave a new direction to the chemical research of active constituents.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a medical scientist in experimental pharmacology he gave new direction to chemical research of active constituents.
As a medical scientist in experimental pharmacology he gave new direction to chemical research of active constituents.

sen.j: 明治35年（1902年）3月学術視察の為欧州各国巡歴を命ぜられ、各国を1年間視察する。
sen.e: In March 1902 Juntaro was assigned to tour European countries for academic inspections, which lasted one year.
In March 1902 Juntaro was assigned to tour European countries for academic inspections, which lasted one year.
In March 1902 Juntaro was assigned to tour European countries for academic inspections, which lasted one year.

sen.j: 日本薬理学会の設立に向け中心的な役割も果たした。
sen.e: Juntaro also played a central role in establishing the Japanese Pharmacological Society.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Juntaro also played a central role in establishing the Japanese Pharmacological Society.
Juntaro also played a central role in establishing the Japanese Pharmacological Society.

sen.j: その後の研究成果として、高橋改良肝油、肺炎薬「レミジン」、肺結核薬「ファゴール」、強心薬「パンギタール」など世の中に送り出し、日本薬物学の泰斗にふさわしい業績を残した。
sen.e: As for his research achievements after that, he gave the world Takahashi Improved Fish-Liver Oil, 'Remijin' a medicine for pneumonia, 'Fagol' a medicine for pulmonary tuberculosis and 'Pangital' a cardiotonic and was a great authority on Japanese pharmacognosy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As for his research achievements after that, he gave the world Takahashi Improved Fish-Liver Oil, 'Remijin' a medicine for pneumonia, 'Fagol' a medicine for pulmonary tuberculosis and 'Pangital' a cardiotonic and was a great authority on Japanese pharmacognosy.

As for his research achievements after that, he gave the world Takahashi Improved Fish-Liver Oil, 'Remijin' a medicine for pneumonia, 'Fagol' a medicine for pulmonary tuberculosis and 'Pangital' a cardiotonic and was a great authority on Japanese pharmacognosy.

sen.j: 門下生は、猪子吉人、森島庫太、林春雄、石坂友太郎、石坂伸吉、岩川克輝、ほか数多くの門人を輩出した。
sen.e: Juntaro taught many students such as Yoshito INOKO, Kurata MORISHIMA, Haruo HAYASHI, Tomotaro ISHIZAKA, Shinkichi ISHIZAKA and Katsuki IWAKAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Juntaro taught many students such as Yoshito INOKO, Kurata MORISHIMA, Haruo HAYASHI, Tomotaro ISHIZAKA, Shinkichi ISHIZAKA, and Katsuki IWAKAWA.
Juntaro taught many students such as Yoshito INOKO, Kurata MORISHIMA, Haruo HAYASHI, Tomotaro ISHIZAKA, Shinkichi ISHIZAKA, and Katsuki IWAKAWA.

sen.j: 彼らは明治後年から大正・昭和にかけて薬理学の基盤を広めて行く。
sen.e: They spread the basics of pharmacology from the late Meiji era through to the Taisho and Showa eras.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They spread the basics of pharmacology from the late Meiji era through to the Taisho and Showa eras.
They spread the basics of pharmacology from the late Meiji era through to the Taisho and Showa eras.

sen.j: 大正7年（1918年）、第一次世界大戦当時に大流行したスペインかぜ（流行性感冒）が世界的に蔓延し、アメリカのスペインかぜの死者は欧州で戦死するアメリカ軍人の9倍に上った。
sen.e: In 1918 Spanish flu (influenza), which had been epidemic during the First World War, spread world wide and the number of deaths from Spanish flu in the US was nine times higher than the number of the deaths of American soldiers in the war in Europe.

In 1918 Spanish flu (influenza), which had been epidemic during the First World War, spread world wide and the number of deaths from the Spanish flu in the US was nine times higher than the number of deaths of American soldiers from the war in Europe.

In 1918 Spanish flu (influenza), which had been epidemic during the First World War, spread world wide and the number of deaths from the Spanish flu in the US was nine times higher than the number of deaths of American soldiers from the war in Europe.

sen.j: この時療養中の順太郎。
sen.e: At the time Juntaro was recuperating from an illness.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the time Juntaro was recuperating from an illness.
At the time Juntaro was recuperating from an illness.

sen.j: 肺炎薬「レミジン」の服用と最新鎮咳剤「アンチッシン」を感冒の処方薬として服用を推奨し処方箋を告知。
sen.e: He recommended 'Remijin', a medicine for pneumonia, and the latest antitussive medicine 'Antissin' as the prescribed drugs for flu and made this information public.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He recommended 'Remijin,' a medicine for pneumonia, and the latest antitussive medicine 'Antissin' as the prescribed drugs for flu and made this information public.
He recommended 'Remijin,' a medicine for pneumonia, and the latest antitussive medicine 'Antissin' as the prescribed drugs for flu and made this information public.

sen.j: 日本における蔓延防止の貢献をした。
sen.e: He contributed to the prevention of the spread of flu in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He contributed to the prevention of the spread of flu in Japan.
He contributed to the prevention of the spread of flu in Japan.

sen.j: 明治19年から逝去する大正9年までの35年間、帝国医科大学薬理学教室において薬物探求の一路の生活を続けたが、大正7年（1918年）1月に脳溢血で倒れた。
sen.e: For 35 years from 1886 to 1920 Juntaro diligently researched drugs in the pharmacological school of the Imperial Medical University but in January 1918 he collapsed with a cerebral hemorrhage.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For thirty-five years from 1886 to 1920 Juntaro diligently researched drugs in the pharmacological school of the Imperial Medical University, but in January 1918 he collapsed with a cerebral hemorrhage.

For thirty-five years from 1886 to 1920 Juntaro diligently researched drugs in the pharmacological school of the Imperial Medical University, but in January 1918 he collapsed with a cerebral hemorrhage.

sen.j: 東京・麹町の自宅で療養中にも雑誌寄稿するなど活躍した。
sen.e: Even while recuperating at home in Kojimachi, Tokyo, he worked hard for example by contributing articles to magazines.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even while recuperating at home in Kojimachi, Tokyo, he worked hard for example by contributing articles to magazines.
Even while recuperating at home in Kojimachi, Tokyo, he worked hard for example by contributing articles to magazines.

sen.j: しかし病状が悪化し、大正9年（1920年）6月4日午前8時逝去、享年65。
sen.e: However his condition became worse and he died on June 4, 1920 8 a.m. at age 65.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However his condition became worse and he died on June 4, 1920 8 a.m. at age sixty-five.
However his condition became worse and he died on June 4, 1920 8 a.m. at age sixty-five.

sen.j: 死に際して贈正三位勲一等瑞宝章追賜。
sen.e: Upon Juntaro's death he was additionally decorated with the order of merit, Zo Shosanmi Kunitto Zuihosho (Senior Third Rank, Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure, posthumously conferred).
Upon Juntaro's death he was additionally decorated with the order of merit, Zo Shosanmi Kunitto Zuihosho (Senior Third Rank, Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure, posthumously conferred).
Upon Juntaro's death he was additionally decorated with the order of merit, Zo Shosanmi Kunitto Zuihosho (Senior Third Rank, Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure, posthumously conferred).

sen.j: 墓地は雑司ヶ谷霊園。
sen.e: Juntaro's grave is in Zoshigaya reien (cemetery).
Juntaro's grave is in Zoshigaya reien (cemetery).
Juntaro's grave is in Zoshigaya reien (cemetery).

sen.j: 先生髙橋諱順太郎金澤人學醫東京大學
sen.e: Our guru, Juntaro TAKAHASHI, was from Kanazawa and studied medical science at Tokyo University.
Our guru, Juntaro TAKAHASHI, was from Kanazawa and studied medical science at Tokyo University.
Our guru, Juntaro TAKAHASHI, was from Kanazawa and studied medical science at Tokyo University.

sen.j: 業成官命留学歐洲歸任東京大學教授掌薬物學
sen.e: Following his achievements, the government instructed him to study in Europe and then return to Tokyo University to teach pharmacognosy.
Following his achievements, the government instructed him to study in Europe and then return to Tokyo University to teach pharmacognosy.
Following his achievements, the government instructed him to study in Europe and then return to Tokyo University to teach pharmacognosy.

sen.j: 講席大學之有薬物學教室實自先生始
sen.e: The guru started the university pharmacology department.
The guru started the university pharmacology department.
The guru started the university pharmacology department.

sen.j: 尋為医學博士在官凡三十五年薫陶諸生数千人
sen.e: The guru became a medical doctor and stayed in that position for about 35 years, teaching as many as several thousand students.
sen.cmt: 下のセルの内容の訳もこちらに入っていますが、区切る正しい位置がよくわからないため漢文はそのままオリジナルのセルに入っています。
sen.e: The guru became a medical doctor and stayed in that position for about thirty-five years, teaching as many as several thousand students.
The guru became a medical doctor and stayed in that position for about thirty-five years, teaching as many as several thousand students.

sen.j: 所就甚多先生生於安政三年三月二十八日
sen.e: The guru was born on May 2, 1856.
sen.cmt: 下のセルの内容の訳もこちらに入っていますが、区切る正しい位置がよくわからないため漢文はそのままオリジナルのセルに入っています。
sen.e: The guru was born on May 2, 1856.
The guru was born on May 2, 1856.

sen.j: 薨以大正九年六月四日享壽六十五
sen.e: The guru passed away on June 4, 1920 age 65.
sen.cmt: 最初の数字は前のセルに入るべきだと思います。
sen.e: The guru passed away on June 4, 1920 age sixty-five.
The guru passed away on June 4, 1920 age sixty-five.

sen.j: 晋階正三位勲一等先生切而頴敏所讀書過
sen.e: The guru was conferred Shosanmi Kunitto (Senior Third Rank, Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure).
sen.cmt: 解釈困難のため一部のみ訳出しました。
sen.e: The guru was conferred Shosanmi Kunitto (Senior Third Rank, Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure).
The guru was conferred Shosanmi Kunitto (Senior Third Rank, Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure).

sen.j: 目即成誧到老攻學不倦
sen.e: He accomplished great things and didn't get tired of studying even as he got old.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He accomplished great things and didn't get tired of studying even as he got old.
He accomplished great things and didn't get tired of studying even as he got old.

sen.j: 著述極冨創製医薬
sen.e: He wrote a lot and produced medicines.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He wrote a lot and produced medicines.
He wrote a lot and produced medicines.

sen.j: 以恵世人云
sen.e: This is what people say about him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is what people say about him.
This is what people say about him.

sen.j: 門人森島庫太謹記
sen.e: His student Kurata MORISHIMA humbly notes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His student Kurata MORISHIMA humbly notes.

sen.j: 系譜・親族
sen.e: Origins
Origins
Origins

sen.j: 髙橋氏 本国は越前。
sen.e: The Takahashi clan originated from Echizen Province.
The Takahashi clan originated from Echizen Province.
The Takahashi clan originated from Echizen Province.

sen.j: 加賀藩の髙橋家は慶長3年(1598年）に御算用者として召抱えられてから明治2年の版籍奉還に及ぶ。
sen.e: The Takahashi family were hired as financial officers for Kaga Domain from 1598 until Hansekihokan (the return of lands and people to the emperor) in 1869.
The Takahashi family was hired as financial officers for Kaga Domain from 1598 until Hansekihokan (the return of lands and people to the emperor) in 1869.
The Takahashi family was hired as financial officers for Kaga Domain from 1598 until Hansekihokan (the return of lands and people to the emperor) in 1869.

sen.j: 家紋（定紋）は二重亀の甲ノ内花菱、替紋は三蓋笠（明治3年 先祖由緒并一類附帳 高橋荘兵衛）。
sen.e: The crest (Jomon) of the Takahashi family has a pattern of a flower with four petals in a double hexagon and an alternative crest (Kaemon) is a pattern of three layered straw hats (from List of the Ancestors' History by Sobei TAKAHASHI, 1870).

The crest (Jomon) of the Takahashi family has a pattern of a flower with four petals in a double hexagon and an alternative crest (Kaemon) is a pattern of three layered straw hats (from List of the Ancestors' History by Sobei TAKAHASHI, 1870).

The crest (Jomon) of the Takahashi family has a pattern of a flower with four petals in a double hexagon and an alternative crest (Kaemon) is a pattern of three layered straw hats (from List of the Ancestors' History by Sobei TAKAHASHI, 1870).
